Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 07:24PM blondiex46 wrote: I tell who I want to tell...I have a thing,,"it is mine to tell"....I think people need to respect that.  I have like 2 families older kids 36, 33 and 29 and 17 year old twin boys who are in 11th grade....The older ones actually don't know anything cause I chose not to tell them, the twins I just told the other day cause their therapists thought I should, bad move, they couldn't handle it got really angry and started fighting with each other.   I find myself pushing people away, which is why  I think I am not telling the older kids, I will tell a stranger easier than them.....I think I am trying to protect them from being hurt...they don't go to the drs. appts with me a friend does, and that is bad enough with the puppy dog face....I look fine and act fine cept for the coughing nobody would know, actually my daughter told people that I am not as bad as I said I was.....so now you know why I am not telling her anything....my son who is the oldest doesn't want to know anything, I tell his wife and if he should know she tells him OR he asks.  My grandchildren are 15,13, 7, 5, 16 months and 15 months so the 2 older ones know or have been told but don't know how much they know.  Honestly they will remember me, I want to make sure my grandson who is 5 remembers me, I don't think the younger ones will so when I spend time with them it is for me, not for them....I know that must sound weird but I just don't think I will be here 4 more years (if I do that is awesome) but not sure they will remember anything until they are older then 5.....sorry went on a tangent......my answer, I tell strangers easier then I tell people I know, sometimes it just comes out...don't have family other than my kids and grandchildren, for the most part the chosen friends know somethings, don't know if anybody knows it all...don't think they want to know

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2010 07:36PM blondiex46 wrote: When bc awareness month is coming it sort of depresses me.  During the 14 years that I was "a survivor"  it really bothered me, made me think about it all the time, now since it has recurred I live with it everyday.  PINK sucks these days for me and I don't feel like a survivor which I wrote about a while ago what the definition is of a survivor.  They spend a whole lot of time talking about prevention and mammograms and self examinations but what about us that are literally dying of this disease.  We live with it everyday in our lives, there is no way we can forget about it cause either we are taking chemo, a pill, calling a dr., getting a PET scan, CT scan, picking up our medicine, looking at our bodies that have been scarred as a result of the disease....people can say they understand but they have no idea......I am so a 1/2 empty kinda person, not optimistic at all, and the comment from so called friends are the worst, "well you look fine" what the heck is that supposed to mean. An another thing, all these people saying they have cancer to get money for weddings and to buy themselves things are really getting on my nerves..... People don't want to think that you can die from this I guess,  they have their head in the sand we don't.  Education, well they have to pay attention to it.   We have drs. they tell people they are going to die in xx amout of time, why would they do that, if it was their mother they wouldn't like it.  We spend alot of time taking care of everybody else, not that I want everybody falling all over me, but come have some respect for me trying to survive today and tomorrow and hoping I will be here to see my kids graduate high school in 2012 and then if that happens the next goal is 2 years after that for my oldest grandchild.....don't feel sorry for me, just don't look at me like I have a disease and don't treat me any different. Whew that felt good, lol Sandy
